intro: Platystigma lineare, commonly known as the linear-stemmed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on a variety of host trees. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in opposite pairs along its slender stems. The plant produces white or pale green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, fleshy berries. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical studies.
